events.message: The insured party reported a car accident that occurred on Highway 12 involving their vehicle and another car.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the vehicle collision and damages reported.
A dedicated claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the case and coordinate communication with the insured customer.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment confirming receipt of the claim and informed the customer about next steps.
The claimant was asked to provide police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license for verification.
All requested documents, including the police report and accident photos, were received and uploaded to the claim file.
An investigation was initiated to assess the circumstances of the collision and verify liability and damages.
The investigation concluded with a finding that the insured was not at fault and the damages to their vehicle were fully documented.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering all repair costs and related expenses to the policyholder.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the prompt and fair handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved following the claimant’s acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
The insurance company processed and issued the payment for the agreed settlement amount to the claimant’s bank account.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and no further issues were reported.
All documentation and communications related to the claim were archived in the system for future reference and auditing.
